critique: The document describes the appointment of Mrs. May Cairns Aimone to a clerical position due to her husband's death in the line of duty. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is likely joy or satisfaction that the government is taking care of the widow of a fallen veteran. There might also be an element of sadness due to the circumstances of her husband's death. There isn't much to suggest anger, fear, disgust, or surprise.
